sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: Major programs in kdenetwork include kdict, kget, knewsticker, kopete, kpf, kppp, krdc, krfb, ksirc, ktalkd, kwifimanager and lisa.

sect3.title: kdict
sect3.para: kdict is a graphical client for the Dictionary Server Protocol (DICT).

sect3.title: kget
sect3.para: kget allows you to group downloads.

sect3.title: knewsticker
sect3.para: knewsticker is a news applet for the KDE Application Launcher Panel.

sect3.title: kopete
sect3.para: kopete is KDE's multi-protocol instant messenger client.

sect3.title: kpf
sect3.para: kpf allows you to share files over a network.

sect3.title: krdc
sect3.para: krdc is a client application that allows you to view or even control the desktop session on another machine that is running a compatible (VNC) server.

sect3.title: krfb
sect3.para: krfb is a server application that allows you to share your current session with a user on another machine, who can use a VNC client to view or even control the desktop.

sect3.title: ktalkd
sect3.para: ktalkd is an enhanced talk daemon - a program to handle incoming talk requests, announce them and allow you to respond to them using a talk client.

sect3.title: kwifimanager
sect3.para: The kwifimanager suite can be used to configure and monitor wireless LAN cards.

sect3.title: lisa
sect3.para: lisa is intended to provide a kind of network neighborhood, but only relying on the TCP/IP protocol stack, no SMB or anything else required.
